item.title: 8BitDo Unveils New Mechanical Keyboard And Mouse Inspired By The OG Xbox
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/8bitdo-unveils-new-mechanical-keyboard-and-mouse-inspired-by-the-og-xbox/1100-6528130/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Over the last couple of years, 8BitDo has expanded into the PC peripherals market with keyboards and mice that have been inspired by vintage video game consoles like the NES. For its next keyboard, the company is looking back to a more recent era and taking design cues from one of the coolest-looking consoles of all time: The transparent green Xbox. The eye-catching Xbox-themed 8BitDo Retro 87 TKL keyboard releases alongside a matching Retro R7 wireless mouse mouse on January 16, 2025, and you can preorder both at Amazon.

8BitDo Retro 87 Mechanical Keyboard - Xbox Edition

$120 | Releases January 16

8BitDo's Retro 87 TKL Xbox edition keyboard was designed in partnership with Xbox, and it sports several touches that call back to Microsoft's first home gaming console, including a translucent green plastic shell and directional keys sporting the same colors as the Xbox controller face buttons. There's also an integrated Xbox button for pulling up the Xbox overlay menu on Windows. Like 8BitDo's other console-inspired mechanical keyboards, the Retro 87 TKL comes with two big, customizable microswitch buttons in the same style as the keyboard.

The Retro 87 also features RGB lighting and will be compatible with Windows and Android devices via 2.4GHz and Bluetooth wireless connectivity or wired USB-C. A free month of PC Game Pass is also included in the box. You can preorder the Retro 87 TKL mechanical keyboard at Amazon.

8BitDo Retro R8 Mouse with Charging Dock - Xbox Edition

$60 | Releases January 16

8BitDo is also launching the wireless Retro R8 Xbox Edition mouse, which sports a matching Xbox-inspired visual design as the Retro 87 keyboard. It sports an ambidextrous design with four additional programmable buttons--two on either side of the mouse. Like the Retro 87's directional keys, the Retro R8's extra buttons match the colors of the Xbox controller's face buttons. You can connect use the mouse on Windows or Android devices wirelessly via Bluetooth or 2.4G wireless, or through wired USB-C connections. The mouse ships with a charging dock and includes a one-month subscription to PC Game Pass. Preorders are available now at Amazon.

In case you'd prefer a different design, several other 8BitDo TKL keyboards are on sale for Black Friday. The company has several designs, like the NES-inspired N Edition, the Famicom-inspired Fami Edition, and the Commodore 64-themed C64 Edition. These are all TKL models, meaning they lack the numpad of a full-size keyboard--but if you find yourself missing those extra keys, 8BitDo sells numpad add-ons for these keyboards. That said, if you'd prefer a more all-in-one solution, the company will be rolling out full-sized versions of the N Edition and Fami Edition keyboards on December 12, which you can preorder at Amazon.

As for alternative mouse options, 8BitDo also makes an NES-inspired N30 wireless mouse with buttons and a D-pad that look identical to the inputs on the NES gamepad. It's on sale for $19.80 (normally $30) at Amazon.

8BitDo Retro Mechanical Keyboards

  • 8BitDo N Edition TKL Mechanical Keyboard -- $88 ($100)
  • 8BitDo Fami Edition TKL Mechanical Keyboard -- $80 ($100)
  • 8BitDo M Edition TKL Mechanical Keyboard -- $80 ($100)
  • 8BitDo C64 Edition TKL Mechanical Keyboard -- $84.70 ($110)
  • 8BitDo N Edition Full-Size Mechanical Keyboard -- $120 | Preorder, releases December 12
  • 8BitDo Fami Edition Full-Size Mechanical Keyboard -- $120 | Preorder, releases December 12
  • 8BitDo Retro 87 TKL Mechanical Kayboard - Xbox Edition -- $120 | Preorder, Releases January 16, 2025

8BitDo Numpad Add-ons

  • 8BitDo C64 Mechanical Numpad -- $40.49 ($45)
  • 8BitDo Fami Mechanical Numpad -- $43
  • 8BitDo M Mechanical Numpad -- $43
  • 8BitDo NES Mechanical Numpad -- $43

8BitDo Wireless Mice

  • 8BitDo N30 Wireless Mouse -- $19.80 ($30)
  • 8BitDo Retro R7 Wireless Mouse - Xbox Edition -- $60 | Preorder, Releases January 16, 2025

item.title: Select Video Game Art Books Are Buy 2 Get 1 Free At Amazon
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/select-video-game-art-books-are-buy-2-get-1-free-at-amazon/1100-6528128/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Anyone looking to celebrate their gaming hobby--or find an easy gift for the gamer in their life--can check out a very good Black Friday special on video game art books at Amazon currently. Dozens of deluxe hardcover books are discounted, and many of them are part of the site's Buy Two Get One Free promotion, making the deals even better. As the name suggests, you can choose three eligible items from the list and the price of the lowest-priced product will be removed from your order's total.

As for the art books on offer, there's a lot of fantastic ones to choose from. Prime examples here include modern-day classics like Doom Eternal, God of War Ragnarok, and The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild--games with wildly different art directions that are showcased in their respective books. Other easy recommendations here would be the Elden Ring art books, as you can get Volume One for $45.40 (was $60) and Volume Two for $36.40 (was $60). Each one is hundreds of pages in size and filled with artwork from the game, showing off the concept and development art of the large open world, character designs, weapons, and much more.

Those are just a few of the many art books eligible for Amazon's B2G1 sale. Check the list below for a selection of even more.

B2G1 Video Game Art Books

  • The Art of Cuphead -- $30.50 ($40)
  • The Art of Destiny: Volume 2 -- $29.70 ($50)
  • The Art of Doom: Eternal -- $25.50 ($40)
  • The Art of God of War Ragnarok -- $27.50 ($50)
  • The Art of The Last of Us -- $35.55 ($50)
  • The Art of the Mass Effect Trilogy: Expanded Edition -- $31.50 ($40)
  • The Art of Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order -- $24.50 ($40)
  • The Art of Super Mario Odyssey -- $28.50 ($50)
  • The Art of Titanfall 2 -- $25.10 ($40)
  • Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume 1 -- $45.40 ($60)
  • Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume 2 -- $36.40 ($60)
  • FF Dot: The Pixel Art of Final Fantasy -- $20.70 ($25)
  • Final Fantasy VII Remake: Material Ultimania -- $25.50 ($40)
  • Genshin Impact: Official Art Book Volume 1 -- $21 ($35)
  • God of War: Lore and Legends -- $20.81 ($35)
  • The Legend of Zelda BOTW: Creating a Champion -- $35 ($40)
  • The Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia -- $20.60 ($40)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Hyrule Historia -- $23.60 ($40)
  • Nier Art: Koda Kazuma Works -- $17.80 ($28)
  • RuneScape: The First 20 Years -- $27.50 ($40)
  • Super Mario Encyclopedia -- $27.50 ($50)
  • The World of the Witcher: Video Game Compendium -- $28 ($50)

While the B2G1 sale offers the biggest savings, many other video game art books are also discounted. You can pick up volumes dedicated to long-running series like Sonic the Hedgehog, The Legend of Zelda, and Diablo, as well as newer releases like Horizon Forbidden West and Ghost of Tsushima. Along with tons of artwork, each individual art book on sale is full of insight from the development teams behind each game, giving readers an informative tour behind the scenes of their favorite games. Check out a selection of video game art book deals in the list below. Note that unlike the titles listed above, these books are not part of Amazon's B2G1 deal.

For even more deals, be sure to hit up GameSpot's BlackFriday deals hub.

More Black Friday Video Game Art Book Deals

  • The Art of Deathloop -- $33.40 ($50)
  • The Art of Diablo -- $20 ($45)
  • The Art of Ghost of Tsushima -- $27.50 ($50)
  • The Art of Halo Infinite -- $33 ($40)
  • The Art of Horizon Forbidden West -- $27.50 ($50)
  • The Art of Overwatch: Volume 2 -- $23.30 ($50)
  • The Art of Dead Space -- $35
  • Dark Souls: Design Works -- $28.60 ($40)
  • Final Fantasy XIV: Stormblood Art of the Revolution -- $24 ($40)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Art & Artifacts -- $19.70 ($40)
  • The Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia Deluxe Edition -- $48 ($90)
  • Nioh & Nioh 2: Official Artworks -- $27.50 ($55)
  • Octopath Traveler: The Complete Guide -- $29.70 ($40)
  • Sonic the Hedgehog Encyclo-speed-ia -- $31.35 ($50)
  • Spider-Man: Miles Morales The Art of the Game -- $24.50 ($40)
  • The World of Cyberpunk 2077 -- $21.30 ($40)
  • World of Warcraft: An Adult Coloring Book -- $8 ($13)

item.title: Get Zelda And Mario Switch Games For $30 Before They're Gone
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/get-zelda-and-mario-switch-games-for-30-before-theyre-gone/1100-6528122/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A handful of Nintendo exclusives are down to some of their best prices of the year in Walmart's Black Friday sale, giving you a chance to grab iconic Mario and Zelda games for just $30 each. The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is arguably the most enticing offer of the bunch. This was the first game Nintendo charged $70 for, but you can grab it for just $30--meaning you’ll save an impressive $40 with Walmart’s current price cut.

While several other games were also part of the $30 discount earlier in the week, most have sold out. Luckily, a few notable titles remain in stock, including Super Mario Odyssey and Super Mario Maker 2, discounting both games from their $60 list price to $30. Super Mario Odyssey is still considered one of the best 3D platformers of all time, and Super Mario Maker 2 is a wonderful choice for anyone who has ever wanted to create their own Mario levels. Nintendo Switch Sports physical edition is also down to $30 (was $50). This package includes the full game and the Joy-Con Leg Stap accessory.

A few third-party exclusives are also on sale at or below $30, including Disney Epic Mickey Rebrushed, Sonic X Shadow Generations, Super Monkey Ball Banana Rumble, and Hogwarts Legacy. Check the list below for all the $30 Switch game deals at Walmart.

Note that availability for these deals differs between regions, and some locations may only have digital game codes in stock. Either way, we recommend picking up these games while you can. Like all Black Friday deals, these are only available for a limited time and will likely sell out. In fact, many of Walmart's other Black Friday Nintendo Switch deals are out of stock, so it's wise to grab these games soon.

As for other Nintendo Switch deals that are still available at Walmart, you can grab the Nintendo Switch Pro controller for just $50 (was $70) and a set of Neon Red and Blue Joy-Cons for $60 (normally $80).

Note that Walmart offers free holiday returns until January 31 for items purchased during Black Friday.

Looking for more bargains? Be sure to check GameSpot's Black Friday deals hub for even more savings on video games, Blu-rays, and electronics.

$30 Nintendo Switch Game Deals At Walmart

  • Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed -- $30 ($60)
  • Hogwarts Legacy -- $30 ($60)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom -- $30 ($70)
  • Nintendo Switch Sports -- $30 ($50)
  • Sonic X Shadow Generations -- $30 ($50)
  • Super Mario Maker 2 -- $30 ($60)
  • Super Mario: Odyssey -- $30 ($60)
  • Super Monkey Ball Banana Rumble -- $25 ($50)
  • Get Dark Souls Board Game For Only $51 And Roleplaying Sourcebook For $30

item.title: Zelda Master Sword Replica Restocked At Amazon With $10 Discount Ahead Of Monday's Launch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/zelda-master-sword-replica-restocked-at-amazon-with-10-discount-ahead-of-mondays-launch/1100-6523376/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Legend of Zelda fans who missed out on preordering The Master Sword Proplica earlier this year now have another chance to secure this eye-catching collectible ahead of next week's launch. Amazon has restocked The Master Sword Proplica and is offering a small discount that drops the price to $190 (was $200). This premium Zelda collectible releases on December 2.

  • Preorder at Amazon -- $190 ($200)
  • Preorder at GameStop -- $200
  • Preorder at Entertainment Earth -- $200 (Backordered)

Out of the box, you're getting a life-sized replica of the sword--it has a total length of approximately 41.3 inches--from Tamashii Nations and Bandai Namco and it's made from a high-quality ABS material. You'll still want to be careful when using it as there is some degree of sharpness to the blade. The colors on this prop are quite nice though, and feature rich silver, purple, and gold metallic layers.

The other cool feature on this is that it can blast some sword-swinging sound effects, as well as several songs from The Legend of Zelda series. When you're not admiring it in your hands, you can proudly display it at home on its included stand.

Alternatively, there are some other nice display and cosplay options available for sale. If you don't feel like dropping $200 on the Master Sword, there's a more affordable $25 version available. This one isn't as detailed--or as sharp--as the one above, but you'll probably have an easier time getting into a convention with it and you won't lose sleep about it going through several baggage handlers during your flight.

And what good is a sword without a shield? The officially licensed Hylian shield replica is just $20, and while it won't stop a Bokoblin attack, it at least looks the part if you're aiming to complete your outfit.

More Legend of Zelda prop replicas

  • Officially licensed Master Sword -- $25 ($32)
  • Officially licensed Hylian Shield -- $20 ($27)
  • Officially licensed Master Sword Paladone Light -- $40

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Black Friday: Get An Xbox Series X 2TB Special Edition With $75 Gift Card
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/black-friday-get-an-xbox-series-x-2tb-special-edition-with-75-gift-card/1100-6528133/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Best Buy is offering a long list of great Doorbusters for Black Friday, giving you a chance to save on popular electronics like TVs, laptops, and smartphones. But one of the best deals is for the Xbox Series X 2TB Galaxy Black Special Edition, as you’ll get a free $75 gift card with your purchase.

Xbox Series X 2TB Special Edition with $75 Gift Card

$600

Though it’s not getting a price cut, this is one of the better deals we’ve seen for this special edition Xbox Series X. Since this Doorbuster gets you a $75 gift card, you can essentially use it to get a free game with your purchase. Keep in mind that this isn’t your standard Xbox Series X--the Galaxy Black model comes with a unique design, and its 2TB SSD should be large enough for most digital libraries.

If you don’t need something as impressive as this special edition Xbox Series X, the standard Xbox Series X, Xbox Series X All Digital, and Xbox Series S are also on sale for Black Friday.

The Xbox savings extend beyond just these console deals. Tons of Xbox Wireless Controllers are discounted for Black Friday, including the stylish Sky Cipher Special Edition for $45 (was $70) and the Nocturnal Vapor Special Edition for $45 (was $70). We put together a massive roundup of the best Xbox controller deals, so give it a look if you want a second controller to pair with your new console.

There are plenty of other Black Friday deals on electronics, too. Best Buy’s Doorbusters feature the usual assortment of laptops, TVs, and consoles, but the popular ASUS ROG Ally Handheld PC is also on sale for $450 (was $650). It’s a great alternative to Steam Deck, especially if you want to play games on platforms beyond Steam. You’ll also find the premium LG UltraGear 45-Inch OLED Curved Gaming Monitor for $1,000 (was $1,700), so give it a look if you want to seriously upgrade your PC setup. Check the list below for more Black Friday Doorbuster deals available at Best Buy. You'll find even more savings on video games, board games, anime, and other categories on GameSpot's Black Friday 2024 deals hub.

Black Friday Best Buy Doorbusters

  • Asus ROG Ally Z1 Extreme Gaming Handheld -- $450 ($650)
  • HP Victus (Ryzen 5-7535HS, RX 6550M, 8GB RAM, 512GB SSD) -- $430 ($800)
  • HP Envy 2-in-1 14" Laptop (Intel Core i7, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD) -- $580 ($950)
  • TCL 55-inch 4K Smart Fire TV -- $180 ($330)
  • Samsung 75-inch 4K Smart Tizen TV (2024 model) -- $550 ($750)
  • Samsung 65-Inch Class QN80D Neo QLED TV -- $1,000 ($1,900)
  • LG 48-inch Class B4 OLED 4K TV -- $600 ($800)
  • LG UltraGear 45-inch OLED Curved Gaming Monitor -- $1,000 ($1,700)
  • Beats - Powerbeats Pro Wireless Earbuds -- $130 ($200)
  • JBL 5.0ch Soundbar with Multibeam -- $200 ($400)
  • JBL Flip 5 Portable Bluetooth Speaker -- $70 ($90)
  • MacBook Air 13-inch M2 -- $749 ($999)
  • Roku 65-Inch Class Select Series 4K TV -- $300 ($430)
  • Lenovo IdeaPad 1 Laptop (Ryzen 5 7520U, 16GB RAM, 256GB SSD) -- $280 ($580)
